p: The serotypes of “other EVs” were more frequently observed in children under 2 years of age, and the proportion of “other EVs” decreased significantly with age from 64.1% to 29.4%. Conversely, EV71 and CV-A16 increased with age: EV71 increased from 23.7% to 42.8% and CV-A16 increased from 12.2% to 27.8%. The distribution of the three groups of serotypes (EV71, CV-A16 and “other EVs”) became stable in children aged 3 years and older ( Fig 5).
